result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Portia M Johnson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Portia M Johnson in court.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court for Portia M Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Deferred Prosecution Agreement hearing.
Defense counsel informed the Court that defendant completed a TAD evaluation. Defense counsel stated he has not received a DPA from the State and requests additional time. Court grants request.
DPA Hearing adjourned to Branch 13.
Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Portia M Johnson in court.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court for Portia M Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for a deferred prosecution agreement hearing. TAD evaluation has not yet been completed. Defendant has completed firearm safety course. Case is adjourned in Branch 13.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Portia M Johnson not in court.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court for Portia M Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a status conference. Defense counsel requested to appear a day early. Approved by the Court. 
Defense informs the court the case is in DPA posture. TAD evaluation to be completed. 
Case adjourned.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Portia M Johnson in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for status conference. Defense counsel recently appointed and has not received an offer and is requesting adjourned status date to determine case posture.
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.
All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Status conference scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Portia M Johnson in court without counsel.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Portia M Johnson appeared by video means. Defendant is in process of obtaining counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.  Status conference scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, or no dangerous weapons or firearms.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 05/18/22. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Portia M Johnson in court.  Matthew Richard Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 37.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/16/2022@1:30pm
